bullets.text: Fed cuts rates again; Powell says December easing is uncertain. 10-year Treasury yield jumps above 4% amid two dissenting votes.
Nvidia becomes first company to surpass $5 trillion market value, underscoring AI-driven market leadership.
Alphabet tops $100 billion quarterly revenue; Google Cloud grows 34%; executives flag significant capex increase in 2026 tied to AI infrastructure.
Meta shares drop 9% despite earnings beat, hurt by one-time tax charge and higher AI spending guidance.
Microsoft takes $3.1 billion hit from OpenAI investment and guides faster spending growth; Azure outage highlights cloud dependency risks.
Samsung profit more than doubles as chip recovery strengthens, signaling memory rebound and AI server demand tailwinds.
CBO warns a prolonged U.S. government shutdown could cost the economy up to $14 billion.
Trump administration weighs allowing advanced AI chip sales to China, raising national security concerns and reshaping export controls debate.
South Korea says U.S. agreed to 15% tariffs, signaling tougher trade stance likely to pressure supply chains and allies.
Chipotle plunges 13% after cutting sales outlook, citing pullback from younger diners—stoking broader concerns about consumer demand.
Starbucks posts first same-store sales growth in nearly two years; delivery tops $1 billion, aiding turnaround.
Scientists discover a hidden antibiotic 100 times stronger against priority superbugs, offering a potent new weapon against resistance.
Researchers warn Earth has crossed its first climate tipping point, signaling accelerating, potentially irreversible planetary change.
Diamonds grown at room temperature without heat or pressure could slash costs and transform industrial applications.
